basics.name: Natanael Bimo Priambodo
basics.label: Engineer
basics.summary: Electrical engineer fresh graduate that interest in electronics hardware and firmware development

work.name: Universitas Gadjah Mada (DTETI UGM)
work.summary: Conducted applied R&D across embedded control, instrumentation, and industrial monitoring systems, contributing to multi-project development and testing.
highlights: Limited-Area Electric Utility Vehicle Development (Thesis Project)
Smart Concrete Cutting Depth Measuring Tool (Lab Project)
IoT-Based Safety Monitoring System (Main Capstone Project)
Non-invasive Bilirubin Measurement for Infants (Capstone Side Project)

work.name: Universitas Gadjah Mada (DTETI UGM)
work.summary: Facilitated academic tutorials for Electricity & Magnetism and Fluids, Heat & Waves, assisting undergraduate students in solving complex physics problems.
highlights: Delivered structured tutorial sessions and problem-solving guidance
Assisted students in mastering analytical physics fundamentals

work.name: Universitas Gadjah Mada (DTETI UGM)
work.summary: Supervised Biomedical & Electrical Junior Projects, ensuring safety compliance and providing technical consultation on circuit design and troubleshooting.
highlights: Mentored junior engineering projects with safety-first laboratory practices
Guided Fundamentals of Programming students in C/C++ logic and debugging

work.name: Pusat Prestasi Nasional (Kontes Mobil Hemat Energi - KMHE)
work.summary: Led the technical inspection team for the national energy-efficient car contest, managing the joulemeter inventory and enforcing rigorous electrical safety protocols.
highlights: Managed joulemeter inspection inventory and operational readiness
Enforced electrical safety compliance during scrutineering
Oversaw fuel verification processes for accurate competition scoring

work.name: Pusat Prestasi Nasional (Kontes Mobil Hemat Energi - KMHE)
work.summary: Conducted scrutineering for electrical propulsion systems, verifying compliance with contest regulations regarding battery management and wiring safety.
highlights: Verified electrical propulsion compliance and safety requirements
Inspected battery management and wiring quality per contest rules

work.name: Pusat Kajian LKFT UGM (Center for Energy Studies)
work.summary: Conducted techno-economic and regulatory analysis for power system studies, supporting utility policy and industrial electricity planning.
highlights: Study on Parallel Operation Costs for Industrial Customers
Study of Power Loss Possibilities Regulation in Generation Transformers
Analysis of the Impact of Electricity Tariff Compensation on the Economy

work.name: Semar UGM
work.summary: Led a prototype battery-electric team and improved energy-efficiency performance across national and international competitions.
highlights: 1st place in KMHE 2023 (884.31 km/kWh) and runner-up in Shell Eco-marathon 2024 (903.06 km/kWh)
Optimized data-driven powertrain strategies contributing to 1st place in the Data & Telemetry Award 2024
Managed cross-functional teams of 15+ members across mechanical, electrical, and strategy divisions

work.name: Semar UGM
work.summary: Designed electrical architecture and contributed to telemetry systems and autonomous programming efforts for energy-efficiency competitions.
highlights: Designed electrical architecture contributing to 1st place in Shell Eco-marathon 2023 (779.57 km/kWh)
Implemented telemetry and data analytics system earning 2nd place in Data & Telemetry Award 2023
Contributed to ROS programming team earning 1st place in Autonomous Programming Competition 2023

work.name: PT PLN Enjiniring
work.summary: Conducted feasibility study for grid integration of a 200 MW Gas Engine and 500 MW Combined Cycle Power Plant into the Bali power system.
highlights: Analyzed power flow constraints and load balancing requirements to ensure system stability during peak demand
Supported integration feasibility studies for large-scale generation assets

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

certificates.name: Active Energy Efficiency Using Speed Control

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: CAN-based Networked Control System for Electric Utility Vehicle Coordination
projects.summary: Designed a distributed vehicle control system using a CAN Bus architecture (SAE J1939-inspired) to coordinate multiple subsystems and reduce point-to-point wiring complexity.
highlights: Architected CAN-based distributed control to reduce harness complexity and weight
Designed a custom STM32-based Main Control Unit with real-time task scheduling
Developed and validated an MCP2515 CAN interface library and measured latency under varying bus loads

projects.name: Integrated Concrete Cutting Depth Measuring Device for Toll Roads (with Website Application)
projects.summary: Developed a ruggedized digital depth gauge system for toll road quality control, integrating PCB design, firmware filtering, and field-ready enclosure integration.
highlights: Designed power distribution and sensor interface PCB for industrial field deployment
Developed firmware filtering to reduce noise from uneven concrete surfaces
Coordinated integration with mechanical enclosure design for on-site usage

projects.name: IoT-Based Safety Monitoring System: Sensor Optimization & Human Tracking for Waste Facilities
projects.summary: Built an OHS monitoring system integrating gas sensors and tracking modules to mitigate hazardous exposure in a waste processing facility, including PCB, enclosure, and firmware development.
highlights: Led development of an OHS monitoring system for TPST Sindu Mandiri
Designed PCB and enclosure for durability in harsh environments
Developed firmware for real-time sensor acquisition and wireless transmission to a safety dashboard

projects.name: Hardware Design of Non-invasive Bilirubin Measurement for Infants
projects.summary: Designed optical sensor signal-conditioning hardware for non-invasive bilirubin measurement and implemented serial communication to interface the measurement device with a display unit.
highlights: Designed analog front-end and signal conditioning circuits for optical sensors
Implemented serial communication protocols for real-time monitoring interface
